intro: Meyera sessilis, commonly known as the sessile meyera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Meyera sessilis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in ecological and horticultural studies.
